intro: Centaurea borysthenica, commonly known as the Crimean knapweed, is a flowering plant native to the steppes of the Crimea and southern Ukraine. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, bright yellow to orange-red flowers in composite flower heads, which bloom from June to September. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in open grasslands and disturbed sites. Centaurea borysthenica is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its vibrant blooms.
